Job Title: Senior Technical Architect

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Coastal Cloud is looking for a Technical Architect to help us support our continued growth. The Technical Architect partners with product owner(s), technology engineers, enterprise architects, and business analysts to define technical requirements and translate those requirements, along with business requirements, into an architectural blueprint that integrates applications, systems, platforms, and infrastructure to achieve business objectives. As a trusted technology advisor you must be able to articulate design considerations, trade-offs, and benefits; lead with sound architecture principles and embellish the primary engineering “ilities” (scalability, extensibility, maintainability, security, usability, and availability).
Role Responsibilities:Partners and collaborates with all stakeholders to understand and translate goals and objectives into architecture, roadmaps and capability models. Reconcile different perspectives and drive toward consensus.Engage with implementation teams to encourage and promote use of existing models, methods, services and other artifacts and capabilities resulting in increased speed of technology solution delivery, making such delivery more predictable and increasing the overall re-use of technology components.Creates and maintains reusable artifacts and patterns. Harvests artifacts across initiatives to extend the library of reusable artifacts and patterns or to enhance the existing reusable artifactsDevelops policies, standards, guidelines, procedures and metrics that measure architectural quality and business outcomesCommunicates the objectives and business outcomes of the technology architecture and the associated use cases in which the customer will derive the most value from the proposed solutionEvaluates existing customer technology solutions and platforms and provides recommendations for improving technology performance by conducting gap analysis, identifying feasible alternative solutions, and assisting in the scope of needed modificationsIntegral member of the sales team at Coastal Cloud helping to craft the client value proposition and design the supporting architecture and end to end solutions to deliver strategic benefits and value Participates in or leads a presentation at tech conferences (Dreamforce, Women in Tech, etc.)Evangelizes CC in public & online (LinkedIn, Dreamforce, etc.)Publishes 'Thought Leadership' articles online (blog, LinkedIn, medium, etc.)Help build and nourish our reusable technical assets and technical architecture best practices across Coastal CloudPromote and champion the reuse of common components and utilities across projects and clients
Experience/Skills Required:An expert understanding of the architectural principles of cloud-based platforms, including SaaS, PaaS, multitenancy, multi tiered infrastructure, integration patterns, and application serversA minimum of 10 years of experience in technology implementation for full lifecycle enterprise software projects, e.g., digital transformation programs, Business Support Systems, Operational Support Systems, etc. A minimum of 10 years of experience creating the technical architecture for complex Salesforce implementations Experience in design, configuration, and development of Salesforce solutions related to Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Field Service, etc. Experience with web services (REST & SOAP, JSON & XML, etc.) Software Engineering skills with Force.com platform (Apex, VisualForce, SOQL) and experience developing Lightning Components, Apex classes, Controller classes, Apex Triggers and Visualforce PagesExperience documenting technical solutions or business and system process flow techniques using applicable methods such as engineering drawings, UML (e.g. Use Case Diagrams, Activity Diagrams, Entity Relationship Diagrams) etc.Demonstrated understanding of projects from the perspective of client/user, business, cyber security and technology day-to-day operationsStrong analytical ability, excellent problem-solving skills, and ability to learn new technical conceptsStrong oral and written communication skills, and good facilitation skillsAbility to foster working relationships with Customers, IT Senior Management and Software Service PartnersUnderstanding of technology architecture, technology platforms and ability to explain technical concepts to the business users in the context of business requirementsAbility to define metrics that measure the success of the technology solution in addressing business and technical requirements as well as achieving the desired outcomes
Additional Preferred Experience/Skills:Bachelor’s Degree preferred, or equivalent experienceTravel as needed
Why Coastal, and what we offer:Flexible working hours with an emphasis on a life-work balance (in that order)Remote Work401K with Company MatchCompany provided Health, Dental and VisionContinuing education and certification reimbursementsAn amazing company culturePlanned fun events both in person and virtuallyCompetitive quarterly and annual bonus opportunitiesQuarterly all hands calls to bring the whole company togetherOpen door concept with access to leadershipOpportunities for accelerated growth and the ability to create your career path based on your interestsTrust, Transparency and respect across all levels of the company
Coastal Cloud provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
